<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 305, 220, 320]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 326, 356, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3 (P3)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 415, 390, 433]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 446, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 463, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 478, 504, 494]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 494, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 509, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 585, 595, 600]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 600, 606, 616]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 629, 609, 645]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 644, 757, 660]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 660, 440, 676]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 853, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\ln (x^{2} + 1) = 1 + 2\ln x\), giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[870, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 74, 161, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Express the equation \(\cot \theta - 2\tan \theta = \sin 2\theta\) in the form \(a\cos^4\theta + b\cos^2\theta + c = 0\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 73, 702, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\cot \theta - 2 \tan \theta = \sin 2\theta\) for \(90^\circ < \theta < 180^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 91]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 73, 437, 92]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 100, 626, 119]]<|/det|>
\[x = t^{2} + 1,\quad y = 4t + \ln (2t - 1).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 144, 156, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[171, 141, 361, 170]]<|/det|>
Express \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\) in terms of \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 147, 920, 165]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the normal to the curve at the point where \(t = 1\). Give your answer in the form \(ax + by + c = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 85, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 149]]<|/det|>
In a certain chemical process a substance \(A\) reacts with and reduces a substance \(B\). The masses of \(A\) and \(B\) at time \(t\) after the start of the process are \(x\) and \(y\) respectively. It is given that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dt}} = - 0.2xy\) and \(x = \frac{10}{(1 + t)^2}\) . At the beginning of the process \(y = 100\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 163, 153, 182]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 163, 751, 183]]<|/det|>
Form a differential equation in \(y\) and \(t\), and solve this differential equation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 164, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 73, 672, 92]]<|/det|>
Throughout this question the use of a calculator is not permitted.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 463, 123]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(2 - \mathrm{i}\) is denoted by \(u\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 136, 156, 154]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 135, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(u\) is a root of the equation \(x^{3} + ax^{2} - 3x + b = 0\), where the constants \(a\) and \(b\) are real. Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 152, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
On a sketch of an Argand diagram, shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) satisfying both the inequalities \(|z - u| < 1\) and \(|z| < |z + \mathrm{i}|\). [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence obtain the expansion of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 92, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 112]]<|/det|>
Relative to the origin \(O\), the point \(A\) has position vector given by \(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + 4\mathbf{k}\). The line \(l\) has equation \(\mathbf{r} = 9\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + 8\mathbf{k} + \mu (3\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + 2\mathbf{k})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 121, 156, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 121, 920, 156]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of the foot of the perpendicular from \(A\) to \(l\). Hence find the position vector of the reflection of \(A\) in \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the plane through the origin which contains \(l\). Give your answer in the form \(ax + by + cz = d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 599, 186, 618]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 599, 725, 618]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of the perpendicular distance of \(A\) from this plane.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 596, 920, 615]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 74, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[351, 84, 685, 207]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 228, 920, 266]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = x^{2}\cos 2x\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant \frac{1}{4}\pi\). The curve has a maximum point at \(M\) where \(x = p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 282, 156, 301]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 279, 561, 307]]<|/det|>
Show that \(p\) satisfies the equation \(p = \frac{1}{2}\tan^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{p}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 282, 920, 301]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 606, 186, 625]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 599, 920, 640]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula \(p_{n + 1} = \frac{1}{2}\tan^{-1}\Bigl (\frac{1}{p_n}\Bigr)\) to determine the value of \(p\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 636, 920, 655]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Find, showing all necessary working, the exact area of the region bounded by the curve and the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
